definition:
Let $E$ and $E'$ be elliptic curves over a field $k$. An [*isogeny*]{}
between $E$ and $E'$ is a finite morphism $f : E\to E'$ of varieties
that preserves basepoints.

The two curves are called [*isogenous*]{} if there is an isogeny between
them. This is an equivalence relation, symmetry being due to the
existence of the dual isogeny. Every isogeny is an algebraic
homomorphism and thus induces homomorphisms of the groups of the
elliptic curves for $k$-valued points.
